Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by its completion, its conclusion, and its explanations, it seems to me that I have fulfilled it for you with this treatise, which is a section of the manual operation, that is, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because manual operation is largely lost in our region and time, almost all knowledge of it is lost; only a few small descriptions in the books of the ancients remain, which have led to errors and hesitation, so that the understanding of it, and the skill and art, have been lost.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revive that [manual operation] through the organization of this treatise, in the way of exposition, explanation, and abbreviation; and so that it will come with the forms of cautery instruments and other tools of the craft, it is necessary to add a description and preparation of these.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a skillful artisan with their hands is not found in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive, and that its practitioners must beforehand be practiced in the science of anatomy, which explains the structure of the limbs, and the forms of those, their connection and separation; and must have knowledge of the bones, nerves, and muscles, their number and arrangement; and of the pulsating and still veins, and the places of their emergence.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that reason, Hippocrates said that with one name [i.e., a general concept] it's a great deal, but in the practice [i.e., in the hands-on work] it's small, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction to this book; because whoever is not familiar with what we have said about anatomy will certainly fall into an error by which men will die, as I have seen many of them; for some are trained in this science and abandon it without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and inexperienced physician attempt to lance a scrofulous abscess on a woman's neck, and opened some arteries in the neck so that a great deal of blood flowed until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician attempt to remove a stone from a man who had suffered from it for a long time.  The stone was large, and he proceeded to remove it with a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I, having already called myself to account, saw that because of the size of the stone and the patient's condition, I knew he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician, who received payment from a duke in our land for surgery, and he was treating a black man who had a fractured thigh.  Through the physician's ignorance, he treated the fracture, applying bandages and splints with excessive pressure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he followed his desires, and then he bound it, and then he left it for a few days and commanded that we untie the ligament. And it remained like this until the thigh and the foot became abscessed, and led to destruction.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I proceeded to untie the ligament, and consequently, there was tranquility and a lessening of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, since corruption was already established in the limb, I could not stop it, and the corruption continued in the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who opened a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated after a few days, until the evil of it was magnified by the patient's condition.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Since this condition is caused by black bile, it is not necessary to destroy it completely by any iron, but rather that the limb that suffers from its complete removal should be carefully considered.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the operation be divided into two parts: one where the operation is associated with health, and the other where the operation holds danger in its most severe forms.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already avoided this throughout this book in which the operation contains error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against it and leave it aside, so that the pages do not find a way to speak and disgrace you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your weapons with diligence and with God's protection, and your patients with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best path, by God's grace, aiming for health and praiseworthy success, and abandon those terrible illnesses with difficult cures, and remove from your armour anything that makes you afraid, so that your faith and your name might not fail you: for greater glory remains for you, and higher in the world and behind your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Already has Gualia said in some of her teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a bad illness, so that you are not called bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have now divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, ordered from head to foot, describes the forms of instruments and the tools for cauteries, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on cutting, piercing, cupping, poultices, the extraction of arrows and similar things, is a complete and ordered chapter concerning the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twisting and similar things; a chapter ordered from head to foot, and concerning the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and with sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to explain the benefits and harms of this cautery, and in what constitution it is forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the discourse on the benefits and harms of cautery is long and verbose, subtle in its science, and a hidden secret; and many learned people have already spoken of it, and disagreed about it, but a little of their discourse will suffice me, fearing to prolong it.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery benefits all constitutions universally, whether with matter or without matter, except for two constitutions, which are hot constitutions without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry constitution with matter, there is disagreement; for some say that cautery is beneficial for that, and others say the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for an illness that is characterized by heat and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is not appropriate for a hot and dry illness to be cured with something that is also hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite argue that cautery is beneficial in every hot and dry illness affecting the body, because when you compare the body and its humours to the constitution of fire, you find the body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, concerning this matter, that experience has revealed this to me on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate for someone to comment on this who has not already been practiced and skilled in the chapter on cautery through prior exercise, and who has not understood the diversity of human constitutions, the nature of diseases in themselves, their causes, their symptoms, and the appropriate timeframe for treating them.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other constitutions, there is no need for concern, and especially in cold and moist illnesses, for all physicians have agreed on these, and there is no disagreement on the benefit of cautery in such cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing through cautery with fire, and its efficacy, differs from cautery with medicinal burning agents, because fire is simple, its action only affects the part cauterized, and does not harm other parts connected to it, except with minor harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medicinal burning agents reaches those parts of the body that are distant from the application, and easily causes difficult-to-heal illnesses and severe harm in the affected part.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	However, fire, due to its intensity and the goodness of its substance, does not do this, but rather it's superfluous.  And this is already known to us through experimentation and long study of the art of understanding the truth of causes; and because of this, I am excused from a long discourse.  If it were not that it is not written in my book on this subject, and that the secrets related to fire, its effect on the body, and the expulsion of ailments by means of fire, are hidden from you, a philosophical demonstration would be appropriate for your understanding.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree about the time when cautery is most appropriate, and they suggest the best time is spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is appropriate at any time, because the harm caused by an inappropriate time is outweighed by the benefit of what is removed with cautery, especially if the cautery is performed for severe and urgent pains or ailments that cannot tolerate delay because the feared harm (the disease) is greater than the minor damage that time might cause.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not in your understanding, or children, this is only believed by the ignorant populace and foolish physicians, that is to say, that the disease cured by cautery is not always beneficial, and they ignore the consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not at all as they suppose, for cautery is not just any medicine that alters the constitution and dries out the humors that are the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cautery is superior to other medicine because of its power and efficacy, and the greatness of its effect.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness may return at some time, depending on the patient's constitution, the location of the illness, the patient's strength, and the accumulation of superfluous humors in the body, as well as what has been acquired through their diet and similar causes.  However, if the illness for which cautery is administered is a localized ailment with only a small amount of superfluous humors and moisture, such as toothache and similar conditions, it is possible that the pain will not return, but this is in small cases.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cautery is the last resort in medicine, and this is a true statement, not in the way they understand it, for they believe there is no cure that benefits more than cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is the opposite of that; the idea that cautery is the last resort in medicine is only true when, in some illnesses, we have exhausted other methods of treatment and those remedies have not helped, and then at the end of the process, cautery is applied and proves useful.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And therefore, the statement that cautery is the last resort in medicine is not true according to the understanding of the common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they said this only because of the nobility and superior nature of gold's substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not do harm, though this is not entirely true, for I have tested this and found that it only does so in certain bodies and not others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron, as they said; however, when you perform cautery with gold, it is not immediately evident, because it is heated according to the amount you desire by the density of the gold, and because it is prepared to receive cold; and if you apply heat, the gold melts in the fire, and in the fire certain flakes fall, so that the craftsman is harmed by the work.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cautery with iron is done more easily and more appropriately for the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cautery according to topics, and I have arranged them from head to feet, so that the seeker can find what they need.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for headaches caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization addresses the dampness and cold affecting the brain, which has two main causes:  an excess of rheumatic fluid (called catarrh), flowing from the head to the eye and ear areas;  excessive sleep; toothache; and pain in the throat.  More generally, it treats all illnesses stemming from cold, including paralysis, stroke, and similar conditions.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method for this cauterization is as follows: first, instruct the patient to take laxative medicine to clear the head for three or four nights, depending on the patient's strength, age, and usual response.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then, tell him to shave his head, and afterwards, place him on a smooth bench with your hands supporting his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the blade of your palm (or the blade of the instrument) near the bridge of his nose, between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, once your middle finger has reached the place, mark that spot with a probe, and then apply the olive-oil cautery, the process for which is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place it (the cautery) on the spot marked by the probe,  so that it descends, gradually pressing your hand down, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then gently lift your hand and observe the area. If you see a noticeable amount of bone exposed, about the size of a grain of millet, then elevate your hand, and if not, return your hand with the iron, another one from the set, if it's cooled down, until the bone is visible as I told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it over the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then apply a cloth soaked in broth and leave it on until the scab from the burn is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with tetrafarmacon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if the wound remains open, the better you move the arm, because it is better and more helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's marrow is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then whatever is burned off the bone should be scraped off, and then it should be treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery they should proceed to the back, until it firmly presses on the bone, so that the bone gives way.  This is the method of a small cauterization.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that vapors from the head escape from that area.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I have not seen these two types of cauterization in all cases, but in some people according to a fearful approach; and in my opinion, it is better, when possible, with healing, for the head is weakened by the disruption of its continuity, just as we have seen in other limbs, and especially when the patient's head is of a weak constitution.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cauterization is safer and better in my opinion; and by using it and with that procedure, healing occurs.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and prolonged pain affects the entire head in a prolonged illness, and treatments like leeches, cups, head purges, plasters, poultices, baths, lotions, and similar remedies have been used, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cauterization method that we have described and no benefit comes from those things, then consider that if the patient's head has a strong constitution, and it is not frail and is subjected to considerable cold, then cauterize with another cauterization technique beneath the first one a little bit.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area over the patient's forehead with a cauterizing instrument until the pain is relieved.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut open the pain and expose the bone to the extent we described, and cauterize that area with a cautery on the back of the head, in the location called the *vas* (vein) – which is the area where a cupping vessel is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And ease your hand in doing this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience very severe pain, different from the pain caused by other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I would advise this cautery in this place, because the cautery used for cauterizing the temples and occiput should be a more delicate cautery than that used to cauterize the middle of the head; and this is the method for it.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cauterization of non-chronic migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a constant or spreading pain occurs in the head, or extends to the eye, the head should be cleared with medicaments, and the other treatment, which I have described in the discussions of illnesses, should be administered; and if all of this is ineffective, then cauterization in that area is done in two ways: either with a sharp, burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with a burning medicine is that you take a clove of garlic, and squeeze it and incise the extremities of it at both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then you cut the area of pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until a space is made beneath the skin, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press on it with a bandage to constrict it, and leave it for three hours; and then remove it and take away the garlic, and let the wound be for two or three days, and then apply cotton soaked in butter until the area heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines, which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron, according to this method:  heat the cautery iron, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a "claus clavilhs," for its head is like the shape of a nail, in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it is a small eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the painful area, and hold your hand — so the underlying skin isn't burned — and rotate the iron slowly with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount burned by the sharpness of the cautery is about half, then lift your hand so the underlying artery isn't burned, to prevent blood flow.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak cotton in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; then place cotton soaked in butter, and then treat with ointment until healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the sharp edge of a knife as a cautery, and be careful not to cut an artery in this particular, somewhat unusual, procedure.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of an old migraine.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migraine using what we have described in the previous treatment and what we have discussed in the divisions of illnesses, and the treatment proves ineffective, and sometimes the ailment resists what we have described regarding the initial cauterization with medicine or cauterization with fire, then you must heat the knife cautery until it is white-hot, then draw a line on the area of pain, a length equal to half a finger or thereabouts; press your hand down once, and press firmly until you cut into the artery and penetrate down to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful of the continuation of the jawbone, which is strained by chewing, and that the ligaments and nerves that control it are not overly tense and that a spasm does not result.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution of the blood flow from the cut artery, for fear exists in its cutting, and even more so for him who does not understand what he does and is not studious and skilled; and he abandons the operation at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will bring a reminder of the treatment for accidental blood flow from an artery according to its method, in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this ailment is not relieved by this cautery and you see the patient's condition as tolerable, cauterize the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery that we have described in the chapter on the constriction of arteries with a cautery having two blades; this is a better and more beneficial cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear is caused by cold and is treated with laxative remedies and the other treatments mentioned in the previous section, and the pain persists, then apply the cautery, specifically the one called the *puncta* (pointed cautery).  Its form is this:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then, apply the heated point [of the cautery] around the ear, moving it in a circular motion, or in a circuit around affected areas if the pain is localized.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery from the base of the ear slowly, after marking the area with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery is used with ten points throughout the ear, then treat the affected areas until they heal.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of the tumour.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	A tumour that is cured with cauterization is only of the types that arise from phlegm, as we have stated in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type that comes from drying or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of tumor with herbs, purging, and other remedies, and your treatment does not work, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the root of the ear, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the juncture of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the diseased area, for softening only comes to the side that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize the area directly at the end of the ear, slightly above the corner of the head, and another one on the temple, the length of which should be equal to the length of the index finger, and hold the cautery there until the quantity of the inflamed portion of the condition has been burned away by half.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauterization, and it is a type of surgical procedure, the form of which is set forth below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than that described; and it is necessary to cut away a little of the superfluous thickness there.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what has been previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization for old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you have treated it with what we have said, and your treatment is not effective, and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize with four cauteries: on all the temples of their head; and with a cautery on the middle of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of cauterization is done according to what has been previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and further back; and then it should be treated with the following procedures.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization of oblivion caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	There should be given to the sick person at the beginning large jars and pills that purify the brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the entire head of the patient and apply a plaster of centaury, as described in the treatise on plasters, to the patient's temples.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that several times, for that is a method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order which I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so if by that treatment he is cured, well and good; but if not, then apply three cauteries to the back part of his head, which descend from the most superior part of the head down to the part of the neck below.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the thickness of the finger between each cautery, and then treat the cautery with what has been previously described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you wish to increase the application, and the patient can tolerate it, then apply a cautery in the middle location; and if you wish a greater application, then cauterize it over the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the cautery be oily according to the previously given method.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of the cauterization of paralysis and the softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You should proceed with cleaning the head with herbs and as we have said; and then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with a cautery on all the horns of the head, and with a cautery on the back part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if in the illness of softening of the body, the patient and the illness are severe, then cauterize it with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and subsequently with a cautery until it is softened from the spinal cord, and remove your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat it until it is healed, and this should be an olive cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat the brain from the beginning with herbs and other treatments that we have discussed in the section when the patient is severe and able to tolerate the impact of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate the medicines, then administer remedies and chewing agents that treat the brain, previously for many days, with a beneficial diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, following the previous method, and with another cautery on the back of their head, and cauterize on each temple of their head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is severe and able to tolerate it, then cauterize it with the cauteries I have mentioned, having simultaneously paralysis and softening of the body, on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-oil-based, as was previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then place a delicate cautery, according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Concerning the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and thick phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries that we have described in the section on paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is a superfluity inclining towards melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give him to drink that which purifies his brain, according to what has been previously stated in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then apply a properly made plaster to it around the circumference, and then place that in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated upright, and supported on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply liniment; and a boiled sheep's wool is even more worthy.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over the fire with a moderate heating, which the said patient can tolerate when it is applied to him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply that to the middle of his head in a circular motion, and leave it until it has cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once a week, with the other remedies for him until he is healed; or, if you wish, cauterize the area making small punctures according to his tolerance, but keep your hand with a properly arranged cautery. This is a type of cautery which moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then apply this cloth soaked in boiled or warmed wine.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Concerning the cauterization of descending water in the eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have observed the beginning of water in the eye according to the signs described in the previous section, then begin giving the patient a drink that will modify the condition of his head and protect him from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have him sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of his head; and then cauterize with two cauteries on both temples if the water affliction is in both eyes, or on one temple if the affliction is in one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize all the veins and arteries under the temple; and let the cauteries be of that length in the breadth of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from him, stop it with any medicine possible to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with skill in the extraction of arteries and with the excision of them and precaution against blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck between the two bones with two cauteries directly applied.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old sores.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When sores on the face are old, persistent, and through the veins and arteries visible on the surface of the head, and it is clear that this is due to cold phlegmatic superfluities, then cauterize this with the cautery we described in the chapter beginning with hot water on the sores, and with a cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on the neck below the temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below the two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if further treatment is needed, then cauterize that along the entire edge of the sore on the eyebrow's extremity with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of a foul odor from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat it with what we've discussed in the division and your treatment is ineffective, then you prepare and give the patient poppy seeds to drink for three nights; and then wash his/her head, and cauterize it with a milder cautery and an olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize it with a clove cautery, using two cauteries on the two eyebrows below the hair, a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the spark so you don't set it on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the clove cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you [do so], cauterize the area above the two eyebrows slightly with two cauteries, in all directions, and they should be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the amount of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cautery too hard, but according to the amount needed to adhere the third part of the eyelid.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Concerning cauterization of the eyelid when the lashes have grown inward and are irritating the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyelashes of the eye have turned inward, irritating the eye, cauterization in such cases is done in two ways: either with a burning iron or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cautery using fire, first instruct the patient to remove their eyelashes, as if one would pluck them, until they are elongated and plucked out; and if you cauterize just beneath their roots, then bind their eyes with a bandage so that they are not irritated until the eyelashes have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, when they have grown back and been plucked out, place the patient's head on your lap, and carefully apply a cautery to the eyelid(s) using a cautery tool shaped like a myrtle leaf, starting the mark near the lashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place cotton soaked in egg white or a pilli mixture over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery, which has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize the marked area, little by little, many times, until the surface of the skin, which is like a myrtle leaf, is completely charred.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of successful treatment is that you see the eyelid drawn in and the eyelashes raised towards the puncture in the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it for three days, and then place cotton with lint over it until the scab is removed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if any cause returns to the roots of the hair, and the eyelid is softened, then do the cauterization again, just as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are under the eyelid, then cauterize them until they are raised to their natural place and are embedded, and the hairs no longer prick the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to leave the hairs until they are elongated and embedded, and then a leaf-shaped piece of cloth should be made, in the form of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known herbs and living ash, or similar things, and thoroughly mix those substances quickly, so that it does not become cold; and then spread this mixture onto the cloth shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place that over the one or both eyes; and place a cloth soaked in egg white underneath the eye, and the patient's head should be in your care.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medicine and press it slightly, but don't remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, because the burning is like a fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And therefore, when the patient feels the burning sensation, remove the medicine and wash it away with your finger; then, when the burning subsides, remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; then observe whether the eyelid has already risen, as if cleansed of the constriction by fire or incision, for then it is good; and if not, return to applying the medicine to the area where the medicine wasn't applied, and do not give up until your treatment is embedded and the eye is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place a cloth over it until the burn is healed, and then treat it with a definitive ointment or another remedy until it is cured.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you, during your treatment, to carefully guard against anything from the medicine falling into the eye, and if the eyelid softens after a few days and some substance from the eyelashes gets into the eye, then repeat your application of medicine to the softened area of the eyelid, just as you did at the beginning, and continue this until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of treating a wound with myrrh.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that human wounds vary in size and severity, and therefore your treatment is performed accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to recovery will not be hidden from him who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Concerning the cauterization of fistulas in the tear duct of a wound.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as described in the classifications of diseases, and your treatment does not improve, you must cauterize it in this manner: instruct the patient to rest their head on your lap, and have an assistant hold the patient's head between your hands in such a way that it is neither moved nor shaken by their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then apply a piece of cotton dipped in egg white or marshmallow pulp over the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then apply the cautery, which has this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is concave, like the shape of a reed or a hawk's wing, on one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if desired, it should be penetrating to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, it should be shaped like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But nevertheless, the concave one is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and through it drain and dry that [infected area].
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the cautery, which is well ignited, on it, and hold it with your hand a little away from the cautery's point, towards the nose area, so that your hand does not stray or the patient is disturbed, and then place the cautery on the inflamed area and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And therefore, if at the beginning of your cauterization you penetrate to the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization once or twice, if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then apply cotton with oil and surround it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is clean as is appropriate in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier practitioners used:  Apply a cautery to the fistula and cauterize it, then place a thin, shaped piece of melted lead into the fissure.  Hold it in place with your hand, securely, to avoid moving the patient, so the melted lead does not reach the sore.  Cover the patient's skin over the fistula with a bandage dipped in egg white or water, because melted lead adheres to the fistula area and heals it with marvelous recovery.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with the cauterization and treatment we have described, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal passage and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose, returning it to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Concerning the cauterization of a fissure in the pot (or perhaps, a fissure in the body).
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Often, fissures occur in the lips, and more so in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures using the methods we have described in the divisions and your treatment is not successful, then heat a small, knife-like cautery according to this form shown below:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its curvature be according to the thinness of the blade (or knife).
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully place that heated cautery on those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a plaster until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or the palate or in the roots of the teeth, an abscess forms, then it breaks, and then it is old, and pus runs and a fistula is formed, and you treat it and it doesn't help with healing, then you must cauterize it according to the amount that is found inside the fistula.  Place that cautery in the hole of the fistula and keep your hand there until the heated iron reaches the bottom, and do this once or twice behind it. Then treat it with what we have said about healing until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore, if the suppuration is separated and healed, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to expose the area and remove the corrupted bone, as will be explained in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines and it doesn't help, then place the patient's head in your lap and then heat the cautery—the shape of which will be given—so you place the cannula on the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it. Keep your hand there for a short time so the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and then repeat the cauterization several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should fill their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, for the decayed tooth is sealed, the softened gums are strengthened, and the corrupt moisture is dried.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Concerning the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold, or there is cold or a worm in the area, and you do not consider medicine suitable for treatment, then cauterization there is in two ways: either with a cow's bladder, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with a bladder is done by taking a cow's bladder, boiling it in an iron container, then taking a piece of cloth and wrapping it around the tip of the probe, dipping that wrapped cloth into the boiled bladder, and quickly placing it on the aching tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this several times until the effect of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cloth in the aforementioned bladder, place that on the aching tooth, and place the heated iron on top of it until the iron reaches the bottom of the tooth cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is done by holding a needle or iron, ensuring its thickness is appropriate so that the heat does not reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery, whatever shape it may be, and place it on the tooth, holding it until the cautery cools; repeat this several times until the pain subsides, either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, during the application of the cautery, the patient fill his/her mouth with a good potion and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with whatever extremity you can.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the method of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization of extrophy.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophy is caused by phlegm and cold humors, and it is not amenable to digestion through medicine, and you desire a quick digestion of them, then you heat the cautery in the manner described below; having two open ends so that the smoke escapes from the cautery through one end, and place that heated object on the abscess once, and again if needed, until you reach the bottom of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then apply the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and then leave it for three days and place a piece of cloth soaked in a solution on top until what the fire has burned is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointments, dressings, and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or cautery should be as described.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of throat obstructions and constriction of the windpipe.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When moisture collects in the bronchial tubes, and especially when this is due to a cold disposition, then the patient should initially be treated with laxative medicines, and then the affected area should be cauterized near the root of the throat in the depressed region.
