And if the ointment is not available to you, then place old cloth over the wound opening so that it absorbs the humidity; and make the patient sleep on the wound so that the trapped fluids drain out.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed since the wound, and you do not observe spasms, tremors, or a bad heart condition, or constriction of the windpipe, and the other conditions are good, then know that the wound is salvageable; and then treat it with poultices and other remedies until healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if healing is impossible, and the wound is perpetually open, then know that a fistula has formed; therefore treat it according to its own specific procedures.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is from a cut with a knife or blade, and is simple on the surface of the foot or back, then treat it with sutures if it is large, or with powder if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if the wound has penetrated the bone, and already detached pieces are present, then you should try to extract those detached pieces by forcing the wound open.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then leave them until the wound has healed, for the extraction of those pieces will be easier then.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other wounds occurring on other limbs, the method of treatment is the same as that which we have already described.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of wounds of the abdomen.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The ailment which occurs in the abdomen is either severe, or mild, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	In severe cases, sometimes the intestine or nerves of the intestine are involved, requiring a more forceful and precise intrusion and suturing.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small rupture is more difficult to repair in another way, and if the reduction of them is more difficult, unless you quickly return the intrusion of them to their place, for it opens and enlarges, making their re-insertion difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	Therefore, the best rupture is moderate, because in that one, the reduction of the intestine is not difficult, as it is in the two previously mentioned types.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that abdominal suturing is performed in four ways, but two sutures are common and applicable to the suturing of other wounds in the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other specific sutures are applicable to other wounds, but nonetheless, they are more pertinent to abdominal suturing.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will explain each to you with exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, I say that when the wound is small and some part of the intestine has protruded through it, and it is difficult to reduce, then this is in one of two ways: either due to the smallness of the rupture as we have said, or when the intestine has become inflamed due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore, when this is the case, you must warm it as follows: you should submerge a sponge or damp cloth in warm water alone, or in water with squill, cyperus, and pepper, and apply this to the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes this is done with vinegar, which has astringent properties, and is better than just water in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And once you see the inflammation resolved, then you moisten the intestine with water in which marshmallow root and mallow have been boiled, for this alleviates the discomfort with little effort.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the discomfort is not relieved by this treatment, then carefully cut the rupture a little with an instrument used to treat hemorrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better, when it is appropriate and does not involve cutting, and there should be no attempt to dry it out unnecessarily and risk further harm.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Concerning the instrument, note its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is sharply curved, the other part is not sharp, and the tip is slender, but not as slender as a spatula; rather, it is slightly blunt.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And thus, if the wound is aggravated and the intestine has protruded, then its reduction should be according to its natural form, back into its proper place, if possible; for that is best.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the rupture is wide and in the lower part of the abdomen, then you should have the patient lie on their back, and raise their legs higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the abdomen, then you should raise the patient's head and feet higher than their lower parts.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly, if the rupture is in one of the two parts of the abdomen, then always keep your attention and consideration on this, so that the part where the wound is is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you should apply this to large wounds and to medium-sized wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, place what you have prepared, and then have the assistant hold the rupture with his hand and close the edges, and then determine whether there is any other reason for the suture or additional cause.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suture: one who takes the needle, or a count of needles according to the size of the wound; and then places the tip of the rupture on the ring finger, and tightens the needle one, or another, so that you don't put faith in the two ends of the cord, with two ends of the thread that is under the cord of the inner parts, until you have made it penetrate that part; and you have already joined the two ends of the cord and the two ends of the thread, making four knots.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then tighten with a double thread around the needle, and sometimes from two parts together, and then close the two edges and the wound with a proper closure; and then leaves the thickness of the finger and puts another needle into that, and then ties that with thread just as it was tied with the first needle; and do not stop doing this if necessary with the needles until you have completed the entire closure of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be of medium thickness between thick and thin, for thin needles easily pierce the flesh; and thick ones are difficult to insert into the thread, and therefore, they should be medium in both thinness and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And the needle should not be inserted into both ends of the thread too quickly, so that the flesh is not pierced easily and the wound is broken open before its healing.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not prolong the suture so that the wound is prevented from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then cut the ends of the needles so that they do not bother the patient during their rest; and you will place on the suture, powders spread everywhere, that hold the ends of the needles; and leave them until you know the wound has healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this type of suture with needles is most suitable for small wounds, for one or two needles, or thereabouts, are sufficient for their suture.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	However, the second suture is common:  and it is that you suture the four ends of the thread and two ends of the cloth simultaneously, with a needle that is proportionally thin and thick enough.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then, when you have pierced these four ends with the needle, withdraw the needle from the same place where you began, so that the thread retracts from the most superior part to the wound, so that the suture is like the stitching used to join fabrics together.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And place between each suture the thickness of a little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture is known/recognised by men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with such a suture, I closed the wound that had befallen a man in his belly, who had been wounded with a knife.  The wound was a gap/break of more than a hand's breadth, and the intestines had protruded about two hand-breadths from the middle of the wound.  The rupture was in the middle of the member; and thus I reduced that protrusion of the intestines, which had been outside the wound for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated in the space of 15 days or thereabouts, and I cured him and he was healed; and after this, he lived for many years, and remained in his usual state/condition.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other physicians had judged that he would not be healed; and by a miracle it was, for I did not heal him with ointment, for it was in a place where no ointment or any medicine was found.  Instead, I placed old wool on the wound twice a day, and applied frequent washes with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I shall describe two kinds of sutures, proper according to the account of Scripture.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with a suture of the thread, and insert the needle from the outside to the inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And thus, as the needle penetrates the thread and into that same tear, following its straight line and length along the whole wound, and leaves the end of the thread at the point where you inserted the needle; and push the needle from the inside to the outside at the other end of the wound.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And then, when you have made that penetration, you then make that penetration again in the same wound end from the outside to the inside; and leave the end of the thread that is on this side, and push the needle into the other end of the wound from the inside to the outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And push with that your penetration with which you push the penetration into the thread at the wound end, which is on the patient's side, until all of that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then, starting from this same side, stitch it with the end of the thread on the other side, and pull the needle out of the thread which penetrated, and then return it to that thread and stitch the end of the thread that is on the other side with this end of the wound; and pull that out of the thread that is on his side.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and again, and do this once more again until you have sewn all that is outside following that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the summary of this method of suturing is that you stitch with a hide-like stitch, with which you sew skin, so that you stitch the thread once from the thread end, and you leave it again until you have completed it.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	However, the second proper type of suture, which you call Gaulish, and this is being told to you by him and for him, is that you sew it according to a similar method with which some physicians sew it, so that they bring each part to its matching part on him appropriately by nature; and they apply the end of another one of his and the end of the wound to the other end of his, and this is done as I have told you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	You must put the needle into the end of the wound near the outside part, and make it penetrate to the inside part in that area, and leave two ends of the thread; and then turn the needle and make it penetrate from the outside to the inside in two ends of the thread.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn each of those, and make each penetrate from the inside part to the outside part in two other ends of the wound on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of suturing is better than the common, light suture, and it is the suture of which prior mention has been made.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the Gaulish method.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And some might say that the suture of the belly is rectified with two needles, which means that you insert a thread into each of them, and begin by inserting the needle from your side, and make it penetrate to the other side, according to the suture of those who know how to sew the skins evenly.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when the rupture is in the middle part of the belly, then the suture there is more difficult than in other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of the treatment of plague is the judgment of other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which means that when you manage a recent plague with its blood before the air alters it, and you return the bowel to its place and sew it up and prepare it properly, then apply incarnating powder over it.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then apply some of the ointments that you have present until they form a hard scab and the pus falls out, and they are consolidated, cleaned and looked at; and then treat it in the same way as the treatment for other plagues until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines present, then apply immediately, as soon as it begins to discharge pus, old cloth, and change it twice a day, as you were taught, until it is healed, for you will not need another treatment in many cases when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague will spread to the major limbs, then you should soak lion's wool in oil of good quality, or in scented oil, and place it around the areas between the armpits and under the arms.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or putrefaction in their bowels, which often happens, then treat it with black astringent wine, and especially if the hardness has reached the bowel and has made a penetrating exit into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that that which is in the large bowel is easier to heal than that which is in the small bowels.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal, for the bowel called the "jejunum" does not receive a cure from a plague that affects it completely; and this is because of the large number of veins within it, and the size of those veins, and the delicacy of its structure, and because it is close to the nature of the nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what proceeds from the plague is the tissue, and you get a fresh one, reduce it according to your method for reducing the intestines likewise.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has progressed to that stage and is already green or black, then you should press that area with a cloth over the darkened spot, so that blood flows, for there are veins and arteries in the tissue.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then you should cut what is around that ligament, and place the two ends of the cloth hanging from the part below the plague outside of it, so that the pull of it from the wound closure and the release of the plague's arm is alleviated.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	A reminder of the plagues when they occur in the bowel.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a rupture occurs in the bowel and is small, it is possible to restore it in some people.  Therefore, I saw one who had been wounded in their belly with a lance blow, and the plague was on the right side of the stomach.  The plague was old and had become a fistula, and gas and wind escaped from it.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then I considered the cure, though I was not confident in its success, but I proceeded to treat it until it was healed and the area was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And after I saw the area healed, I asked the patient about further problems in their belly; and no further harm came to them, and they remained in their usual state, eating and drinking, and then bathed and were engaged in their usual activities.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced people have said that when a wound occurs in the bowel, and it is small, it is necessary to treat it in this way: you should take nettles with large heads; and then bring the two edges of the wound together and place one of those nettles, with its mouth open, over the two edges of the wound. Then, when it grasps them and closes its mouth, cut off its head, as it adheres and is not dissolved.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And then place another nettle next to the first, and do not stop doing this with nettles, one next to another, according to the size of the whole wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then you reduce that and close the wound; and those heads remain attached to the bowel until the bowel is healed; and you do no harm to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the bowel can be bound with fine thread made from the bowel of an animal close to it, after being put through a needle; and you should take the extremity of this thread, and it should be very lean, and tie the end of it to the other thread, wrapped around it, and then thread this thread through the needle and close the wound with it, and then return it to the break.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of suturing with nettles is only according to a path of trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the wound is large and extensive, especially if it is in one of the delicate intestines, for then there is no cure but a mere alleviation, and it is not a complete healing of it.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the treatment of sores and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that every wound and abscess, when it ages and becomes old, and is ulcerated and not healed and continuously discharges pus and is not excised, then, in any limb, is universally called a fistula and we call that a sore.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And a fistula, according to truth, is a hard, white, fibrous growth, without pain, having a cavity like the cavity of a bird's nest; and for this reason, that ulcer is called a "wrenched ulcer," that is, a nest.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And in some people it is moist, which discharges pus; and easily the moisture is excised in a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is thick, and sometimes thin, and sometimes large, and sometimes small.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already said in the division, when I described wounds, that any ulcer which is not healed nor in bare flesh is so only because of one of these causes: either because of a lack of blood in the body; or because of the patient's bad constitution; or because the area between the edges is hard flesh, preventing the growth of new flesh; or because it is of excessive lightness; or because the ulcer itself has rotted, and the matter sent to it is of poor quality; or because the medicine used in its treatment is inappropriate; or because corruption has spread to the region, and is a pestilence; or because of the region's properties, as in Saragossa, where the digestion of diseases is difficult, and the healing of abscesses is slow due to the nature of the place; or because there is a bone, or many bones, there.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all those causes, and the signs of them, and their cure with medicines, in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And it is necessary that I make you aware of the treatment of fistula, which is done through surgery with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistula occurs in all parts of the body; for among those are fistulas that reach large veins and arteries, or nerves, or the spine, or the intestines, or the bladder, or to one of the ribs, or to one of the spinal vertebrae, or to any of the joints formed by such composition as of the hand and foot; and those are those that damage the proximity of the principal limb and similar things.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And therefore, that fistula among these, which is in this way, is among the difficult-to-heal illnesses, and does not receive cure, and dealing with it is labor and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if any of these fistulas does not go to the depths of those places mentioned, and you hope and trust in its cure, and want to understand it, then take a probe of iron or steel, and if the fistula runs in a straight line, explore it with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is tortuous, then investigate it with a probe of fine lead, for lead, because of the lightness of its body, is light and bends towards the tortuosity.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula is very grievous, it is not possible for you to mark it with a probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then irrigate the opening through its openings, for the moisture with which you irrigate it goes towards the other openings and flows from them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire meticulously, according to the manner that is possible for you to know if there are bones or nerves here, and if the cavity of the fistula is distant or close, or if it is a fistula with many openings and this all lies within the totality of your strength, with your questioning, with which you question the patient, and the location of the pain through your pressure with your hand on the area, and similar indications and the accidental causes of the abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all those matters with true discernment, then proceed to the cure according to confidence; and it is that you now consider whether the fistula is a superficial, nearby fistula, or in a salty location, distant from a joint, or a nerve, or an artery, or a vein, or one of the places that I have mentioned to you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you dry the fistula according to what has previously been said about its description, and remove what is in that filtration and corrupt flesh, and that which has arisen in the opening of the flesh, or of pus and similar things, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of deep location, and it is considered appropriate, then it is necessary to cut into it as far as possible for you, and then cleanse it of all its corrupt flesh; and then administer some compresses with sharp medicines, and insert them into the cavity of the fistula, which you have opened with an iron tool.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this with those compresses several times until the sharp medicine corrodes everything that remains in the cavity of the fistula of the corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments that generate healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this, then you cauterize it as we have recounted.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone, and you are certain of this, then you must inquire into it and dry it as we have recounted, if you do not find any cause of a vein or nerve or major limb that prohibits it, as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is any corruption or blackness on it, then you scrape that until all corruption is removed; and then treat it with something that causes flesh to grow until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and still emits pus as before, then know that you have not achieved complete eradication of the corruption; and therefore you must expose it again carefully, thoroughly scrape and cleanse it with your final strength, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it is healed, good; and if not, then know that that corruption is in a distant depth of the body, which has not been reached, and therefore there is no remedy for you but to leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or it is possible for you to remove it, then you remove it with delicate forceps suitable for that.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then meticulously perform the extraction of all of them, and leave no trace of them with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	However, if you encounter any difficulty due to moisture, and in their incision there is no fear or error, then cut those ligaments or flesh if they are present, and expose the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones immediately, then place something over the wound that may close the wound, and leave it until the area around those bones is free of flesh and ligaments, and be careful that the wound does not become consolidated, and that the incision you made in your procedure is constricted.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	However, if you fear it, place on it cotton soaked in oil, or cotton soaked in Egyptian unguent, or in any of the green ointments, for when those ligaments will be softened, and the bones are separated from them, the removal, and the extraction of them, is eased.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone, like a leg bone or thigh bone, or similar to those, and only the surface of it is corrupted, then scrape that with a rasp only on the back until that blackness and corruption are removed, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if the part of it that is corrupted is a large portion, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and cut all the way to the place where the corruption has reached, and then treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I will recount to you what happened to a man in his thigh, so that you may use it as an example and help for your procedure.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There was a young man, around 30 years of age, who experienced pain in his thigh.  The swelling/matter within the body spread until it reached the thigh.  It was a matter of an abscess with a large abscess, and it was not caused by an external factor.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the time passed with this condition due to the error of the physicians until the abscess opened, and many matters flowed out.  His recovery was delayed until the leg became fistulous, and many openings formed, which all discharged pus and bodily fluids.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And so, many physicians treated him for about two years, and none of them were truly skilled in the art, until I was called in.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the matter flowing from those openings throughout his body; and the man's entire body was emaciated and his complexion was yellow.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Then I inserted a probe into one of those openings and the probe reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then I carefully examined all the openings and found them leading to various parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then I incised one of those openings until I exposed part of the bone, and found it decayed, already black and rotten; and a part of the leg was already corrupted, having penetrated deep into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then I closed what I had exposed and prepared of the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I judged that it was not in the bone itself, but rather that corruption that I had cut out and closed, and I had already cauterized it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I applied restorative medicine to the wound for a long time, but it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I again opened and exposed the bone a second time, over the first exposure, and found continued decay with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I closed what appeared to me of that decay, and then I was forced to attempt the healing and restoration of it, but it has not been restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I exposed it again, and did not cease to cut into the bone little by little, in particular, and attempted its restoration, but it was not restored until I cut around a palm's width of it, and removed its marrow.  Then I restored it with medicines, and it was slightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And further operations or cutting into it are not necessary, except for the weakness of the patient, their low tolerance, and their fear of death, for he was experiencing fainting spells at all times due to excessive evacuations/drainage.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And thus healed is by complete healing, and there is nothing in place of bone but hard flesh; and its condition in his body is good, and its strength returned; and it is restored to its proper condition, and I did not see any trouble in his walking or harm in any way.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is protruding from the body, then you must cut it in this way: take a bandage and tie it to the end of the protruding bone, and instruct someone to pull it outward; then place a thicker wool bandage over the first bandage; and now tie it over the flesh below the bone, pulling the end to draw the flesh back into place, and you should expose the flesh where you want to cut, so the cut does not damage the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a piece of wood or plank under the bone properly, for when you do this, the cut will not be prevented from cutting through the corrupt flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And the cutting should be done little by little over the affected area, because if the corruption is within the cavity of the bone and not apparent on its surface, more cutting will be needed.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted but not protruding, with one part still attached to the other, and the corruption is in the middle or a part of it, then you should expose all the flesh; then put wood underneath, and then cut from the first part where the corruption is until the cut extends to the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the cutting be done according to the location of the corruption, a little at a time, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut the corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is connected to the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in a logical place but in a hidden, indirect one.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the bone of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, you must investigate the corruption in whatever manner it appears to you, and expose it, and clean it according to every possible arrangement, and by any means, to be corrected, as long as it does not conflict with any vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the instruments for cutting and sawing these bones are very specific to the placement of the bones, their preparation, their thickness, their subtlety, their size, their hardness, and their rarity. Therefore, you must prepare a suitable instrument for each type of operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation indicates to you the type of instrument you need; when great study, long experience, and knowledge of the methods of this art, and experience with illnesses, are yours, then you yourself will know what instruments are appropriate for every illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I am giving you, at the end of this chapter, the list of instruments you will use as simple tools with which you will proceed to your procedure, which you will test on others.
Forma de serra:	Form of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Form of a larger saw:
Forma de ray:	Form of a ray:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this ray be in the shape of a star-shaped head, and its points be in the shape of the points of a lancehead.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not suitable except that with that [the ray], the heads of the joints be cauterized when they are corrupted, or the mouth is large and wide.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a larger razor than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of a broad razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	The shape of a well-made saw should have a large, high arch, with the sharpness of iron and the blade of a well-made wooden dagger.
Forma de lu:	Form of it:  (or  Shape of it)
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor with a concavity:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Another slender/refined shape of a razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor with a curved end:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small razor resembling a tentacle:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of a tool with which bones are cut/incised:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of a smaller/another cutting tool:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another cutting tool; this one resembling a ray, and its end is like a saw, and it is used in many places in the process of dealing with bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a ray which is suitable for the treatment of a bone that is perforated:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its tip is triangular and sharply pointed.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly, all the things we have said about razors, cutting instruments, and saws should be.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision tips and the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities [of the affected area] may be affected either by an internal or external cause, or if your treatment with those medicines fails to resolve the corruption.  Or, sometimes, the corruption moves within the limb, unchecked by any external cause.  Then it is necessary that you incise that limb where the corruption is most present, to prevent the patient from succumbing to death or the worsening of the limb's condition.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of the affected area is that the limb turns black, as if fire has burned it, or it gradually darkens until the hardness spreads throughout that limb, seizing it and affecting the whole body; and therefore, treat it with incisions.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the corruption is caused by the effects of poisonous creatures such as scorpions, vipers, or other similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or injury is in the extremity of the finger, then you incise the finger, and do not allow the corruption to spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it affects the hand, then you incise it at the root of the forearm, and do not allow the corruption to spread to the upper arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if, instead, it affects the arm, then you incise the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond the elbow, then in that case death is the fate of the patient; and administering any other treatment for this is a waste of effort.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, do for the foot; when corruption reaches the toe of the foot, then you incise it down to one of the bones.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it spreads to the sole of the foot, then you incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it rises to the knee, then you incise the leg up to the knee joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the knee, then there is no cure for them, but only release, and leaving the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way to incise or cut the limb is to tighten the ligament in the part just below where you want to incise, and tighten another ligament over the spot.  And the minister should extend a ligament downwards, and the minister extend another ligament upwards; and you separate the flesh that is between the two ligaments with a sharp tool until all the flesh is exposed; and then it is to be incised or cut.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to place cloths on all sides so that the area does not come into contact with the body, and that the patient receives a well-fitted and carefully treated wound.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if you encounter a flow of blood while working, then you cauterize the wounded area carefully, or place some blood-stopping powders on it; and then return to your treatment until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the wounded limb with a suitable bandage, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I tell you what happened to a man on his foot, the same accident that I and you have recounted, which is that he suffered a dark discoloration on his foot, with a burn similar to a fire's combustion.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first occurred in his toe until it spread to his entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man, realizing that the treatment was going to the affected limb with the intensity of the pain and burn he felt, himself cut open that foot down to the joint, and the wound healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that same corruption happened to him in the finger of his index hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I was compelled to counteract that excess with what I could place on his hand, to cleanse his body; but the excess was not repelled, and it began to move to the other fingers until it spread to his entire hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he urged me to cut open his hand, but I did not want to do that, hoping for the repulsion of that excess, and fearing the death of his hand due to the incision, because the patient's strength was waning.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he left me, he returned to his land, and later it came to me that that man prepared himself and cut his whole hand, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not related this story except to be of assistance to those who suffer from this illness, and to serve as a sign by which it may be recognized and according to which it may be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of sinuses and the quality of enemas using medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs on a fleshy limb, and the space of the abscess extends until it collects pus, and it is then broken and perforated, and the pus is released, and the place remains empty, like a vessel, and the surrounding skin, like thin cloth, has not undergone further corruption, and it has not affected the bone, nerves, or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space extends until the corruption affects any part of the limb, then it is called a fistula, and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment of it is to cut away that surrounding skin completely, especially if it is thinned and like cloth, and ensure that it is not adhered to the affected area due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you expect the skin to adhere and that corruption has not progressed further, and the skin has broken open, then you treat it with an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider it a sinus, and if it is large, and the arm you are treating has a foul odor, then give an enema with Egyptian medicine, which is made of oil, sour wine, and vinegar taken in equal parts, and combined in a vessel, and heated over the fire until the medicine turns reddish-brown and acquires the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then, take what is necessary of it and dissolve it with water and honey; and use this mixture as an enema for the sinus, and compress the opening, and leave the medicine in place for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then, remove that with a compress; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the foul odor is gone.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is treated with ash water, when this medicine is not available to you; and you should take the ash of wood, and put water on it; and then strain that and use it to give an enema until you believe the sinus is closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or ash water, then give an enema with water and honey mixed with crushed vinegar, and give an enema with wine and honey mixed, because honey has the property of cleansing and washing, and wine causes the sinus to adhere, especially when the wine contains an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this several times and believe the sinus is healed, then give an enema with something that promotes the growth of flesh in that place.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take diafinicon ointment and dissolve it with warmed oil and astringent wine; or give an enema with other medicines and ointments that have the properties that I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow, so the enema tube cannot be inserted, then widen it gradually with a small iron, and apply heat wrapped in Egyptian or basil ointment until it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the opening is wide, then you should bring the edges together with sutures and leave it at a size that the enema tube can enter without difficulty.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the pus flows is elevated, then drain it to the lowest part, so the pus flows downwards, because when the pus is trapped within the depth of the sinus, flesh will develop there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to drain the sinus to the desired lowest point, then you must prepare the limb with a preparation through which the pus flows easily, as is appropriate, and that no impediment is left in the sinus to hinder the flow of the pus.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines suitable for this, placing them on a linen cloth over the sinus.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be large enough to cover the entire sinus; then, with scissors, cut a hole slightly larger than the sinus opening, directly over it; and then place a second linen cloth containing the appropriate ointments, sized to fit the hole, on top, positioned slightly away from the sinus opening so as to ease the flow of pus, and leave the large cloth in place only for a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But the one over the sinus opening, which remains in place continuously, so that the pus contained within the sinus flows out.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know whether the pus flowing from the sinus is copious or scant, or digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And by this, consider the location of the sinus, if the patient feels pain there or not, and if there is an abscess there.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter discharged over the sinus opening has already adhered, or is beginning to adhere, then on the third day, you should remove the adherence, and when you remove the dressing, change the cloth and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus a subtle virus quickly spreads, then do not despair of the adherence of it, for the healing of it comes about, for there are some people in whom the generation of flesh in their wounds is slow, and others in whom the opposite occurs.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if for many days undigested matter has been discharged from the sinus, then know that the sinus has not adhered; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and the cause prolonged, then you must adjust the drying properties of the remedies, and if the remedies are moist in their substance and their effect, make them dry, as a diaphanous ointment, when the superfluous addition of the astringent has been adjusted.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The final remedy, by which it is healed, is to take diaphanous ointment and dissolve it in rose-oil, and add some old wine that is strong in its substance, and mix it well with that, and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And similarly in that action, when there is no pus, use diaphanous ointment, honey when it is cooked until thickened, and apply it; or take myrrh, aloe, and frankincense, grind it all into powder, and sprinkle it on the honey while it is on the fire, and then apply this to a cloth and apply it to the sinus; and apply this with the honey, which has been cooked until it is thickened, and sprinkle it on a cloth and apply it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Sometimes, long aristolochia root and the root of the lily of the valley (and it is the lily of the valley), and the flour of erts and centaury are administered with it. Use these simple ingredients, or mix them, grind them, sieve them, and powder them over the honey I have described; use this.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, then know that the corruption is in the deeper part, and it is investigating the bones or other hard parts or ligaments; then treat it with a fistulous cure, as stated above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of felon, and bruised nails, and the incision of the added finger and sectioning (of it).
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A felon is an abscess which arises beneath the nail of the finger of the hand or foot, and often arises on other fingers.  And when it is prolonged and its treatment is less successful, or is an abscess of a hot abscess, or is corrupted, and it discharges pus until it rots the root of the nail, and often completely corrupts it, and often extends its corruption to the bone until it is foul-smelling, and the end of the finger is blackened, and its colour is dark.
